text.p: Diametrics Medical Inc said Thursday it had completed the purchase of Biomedical Sensors Ltd, an operating unit of Pfizer Inc, for $1.5 million cash and a $7.3 million six-year promissory note.
Biomedical is based in High Wycombe, England, and markets a line of indwelling monitoring systems for continuous blood and tissue assessment in critically ill patients.
"We expect this unique combination of products to double Diametrics Medical sales and significantly enhance our earnings potential," David Giddings, Diametrics chairman, said in a statement.
He called the acquisition a major step toward Diametrics becoming a leader in critical care blood analysis systems.

Biomedical will operate as a subsidiary of Diametrics. Roy Johnson, Biomedical president, will continue to lead the business as its president and managing director. He also will be a member of the Diametrics board.
The projected market for point of care testing, excluding near patient laboratories, is estimated at $700 million worldwide and is projected to rise to over $1 billion by the year 2000.

"With the breadth of our product line in bedside testing and patient-attached blood analysis and monitoring, Diametrics should be able to capture a significant share of this rapidly growing market, both domestically and internationally," Giddings said.
